item.title: No Heroes Here 2 launches July 1 for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/no-heroes-here-2-launches-july-1-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-switch-and-pc

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Currently in Early Access for PC.

Cooperative tower defense game No Heroes Here 2 will leave Early Access and launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on July 1, developer Mad Mimic announced.

No Heroes Here 2 first launched in Early Access for PC on October 29, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Mad Mimic:

About

A group of non-adventurers is the last hope in defending the castle in this chaotic cooperative tower defense game with roguelike features. With up to four players, your party must organize the castle, work as a team to craft ammo, and shoot at enemies to protect your kingdom!

Key Features

  • Plan, Craft, and Defend the Castle – Use the power of teamwork to prosper through 15 rounds against hordes of brute invaders by preparing the castle stations, reinforcing your defenses each day and choosing the best curveballs for each scenario.
  • No Heroes? No Problem, Save the Day Anyway! – As you journey through this medieval realm, recruit more Non-Heroes to your ragtag band of castle defenders, including familiar faces like the Jester and the Princess, and non-heroic newcomers like the Alchemist and the Doctor. Just because you’re not a hero doesn’t mean that you can’t save the day!
  • The Kingdoms’ Fate in Your Hands – Protect three different kingdoms with each their own mechanics, enemies, and quirks. Defend your typical medieval kingdom Noobland, the freezing lands of Trollmeria, and the castles overrun by ever-growing mushrooms at Fungaria.
  • A Medieval Arsenal at Your Disposal – Play in 30 different castles, separated between easy, normal, and hard difficulties. Select the kingdom and choose your weapon from cannons, slingshots, and even a baby dragon ready to set hordes of enemies on fire!

item.title: Lost in Random: The Eternal Die launches June 17
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/lost-in-random-the-eternal-die-launches-june-17

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Pre-orders now available.

Roguelite action adventure game sequel Lost in Random: The Eternal Die will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam on June 17, publisher Thunderful Games and developer Stormteller Games announced. It will also be available via Game Pass.

Pre-orders are now available for the digital standard edition and Premium Edition at a discounted price of $22.49 / €22.49 / £17.99 and $24.64 / €24.64 / £23.99, respectively. For the Switch version, only the Premium Edition is available for pre-order.

The Premium Edition includes early access to the game beginning June 13, and special bonuses including a digital art book, exclusive soundtrack, and cosmetic downloadable content. Xbox Game Pass users can purchase the Premium Edition upgrade for $3.59 / €3.59.

Here is an overview of the game, via Thunderful Games:

About

In Lost in Random: The Eternal Die, Aleksandra, formerly known as The Queen, and her companion, Fortune, have been captured inside the Black Die by Mare the Knight, who is plotting their final chapter. Players will fight their way through a randomly generated gauntlet where they’ll take on monstrous pawns and giant board games, to claim treasure which improves their chances of defeating Aleksandra’s tormentor. They must use their wits and trusty die companion to escape this living labyrinth, where evil reigns and Random Rules.

Key Features

  • Mastery Meets Chance – Engage in fast-paced, second-to-second combat that blends real-time action with strategic decision-making—and a touch of luck.
  • Forge Your Playstyle – Wield four unique weapons, throw your die-companion, and combine over 100 relics with powerful card-based abilities to unleash devastating synergies.
  • Ever-Changing World – Traverse four randomly generated worlds, each with its own distinct secrets and challenges and face over 30 different enemy types and formidable bosses.
  • A Dark Fantasy Tale – Immerse yourself in a fully voiced story set in a Tim Burton-inspired world, brought to life with hauntingly beautiful landscapes and an enchanting soundtrack.

item.title: Free-to-play MMORRPG Blue Protocol: Star Resonance coming west in 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/free-to-play-mmorrpg-blue-protocol-star-resonance-coming-west-in-2025

  • PC
  • Smartphone

The resurrection of Bandai Namco's fallen online game.

Publisher A PLUS JAPAN and developer BOKURA will release free-to-play massively multiplayer online RPG Blue Protocol: Star Resonance for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store, iOS, and Android worldwide in 2025, the companies announced.

The game, licensed to BOKURA by Bandai Namco following the closure of the original Blue Protocol, was previously only announced for release in China.

Here is an overview of the game, via A PLUS JAPAN:

About

Dive into a breathtaking anime world filled with stunning visuals, fast-paced combat, and a vast open world teeming with exploration and discovery.

Blue Protocol: Star Resonance expands the Blue Protocol universe with a vibrant MMORPG experience. Create your own hero, team up for strategic raids, or simply relax and have fun with friends fishing, crafting, and endless exploration. Adventure awaits!

Blue Protocol: Star Resonance will support cross-platform play between mobile and PC, allowing players to enjoy a seamless experience across devices with synchronized progression. Whether at home or on the go, adventurers can dive into the world anytime, anywhere.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Welcome to Regnas! – Begin your MMORPG adventure in an anime-styled fantasy world!
  • Explore the Open World – Magna is a vast land full of wonder: mine rare crystals, gather mystical herbs and mushrooms, or stumble into sudden monster stampedes! Between battles, lose yourself in breathtaking vistas.
  • Be Whoever You Wanna Be – Tank with unbreakable shields, heal with radiant spells, or unleash skillful moves to deal great damage—then swap styles anytime! And combat roles are just the start! In Star Resonance, you can also express yourself with deep customization and various outfits that make you a star in town!
  • Rally, Raid, and Reap Your Rewards – Assemble multiplayer parties to topple bosses with attack patterns that are easy to learn but still demand teamwork. Keep looting and make yourself—and your guild—legendary.
  • We Are in This Together – Fish at riversides, dance at the town’s fair, set off fireworks at night, or even meme in guild chat—remember to have fun with friends, because Regnas shines brightest when shared.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.
